block.p: ARISTA RECORDS, New York, named Larry Mestel executive vice president. He had been chief operating officer at Palm Entertainment.
ARISTA RECORDS, New York, named Larry Mestel executive vice president. He had been chief operating officer at Palm Entertainment.

EXCITE@HOME CORP.,Redwood City, Calif., named Mark McEachen chief financial officer, succeeding Kenneth Goldman, who resigned. Mr. McEachen, who was also named executive vice president, had been treasurer at Hughes Electronics Corp.

GENERAL ELECTRIC CO., Stamford, Conn., named Joe Parsons, president and chief executive for e-business at GE Capital, its financial services unit, to the posts of president and chief executive at GE Equity, the private investment unit of GE Capital. He succeeds Michael Pralle, who was named to lead GE Capital Real Estate, a GE Capital division. Mr. Parsons is succeeded by Mike Stout as vice president for e-business; Mr. Stout also remains chief information officer at GE Capital.
THERMO ELECTRON CORP., Waltham, Mass., named Marijn Dekkers chief operating officer. He had been president at the electronics materials division of Honeywell International.
